result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas R. Lavey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop/Fleeing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No Taverns meaning the defendant shall not go on any premises licensed for the retail sale of alcoholic beverages by the drink, which prohibited premises includes taverns.
Absolute Sobriety - no alcohol or illegal drugs.
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle.
Must attend a victim impact panel before September 1, 2015.
AODA Assessment & follow-thru with any recommended treatment or counseling.

w/Huber and good time.

946.04(3) - Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs.
Shall not possess any alcohol on person, in residence or occupied motor vehicle.
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle unless lawfully licensed.
No liquor stores or taverns, meaning the defendant shall not go on any premises licensed for the retail sale of alcoholic beverages by the drink, which prohibited premises includes taverns.
Shall not leave state of Wisconsin without permission of the Court.
Shall surrender passport to the Clerk of Court Office by 02/20/15 at 4:30 p.m.
